about_the_game:
Lovanium is a story-rich 2D RPG with breathtaking battles. Featuring a captivating view and some touches of metroidvania in its gameplay, the game offers a unique approach to achieving goals with its incredible business mechanics and some benefits based on the light of day.

STORY

Captain Sasha, along with her crew, is sent on a mission to uncover the disappearance of a ship after passing through the dark side of the moon. Upon reaching the disappearance site, they notice a small wormhole and are soon drawn in, hurtling into an unknown galaxy and colliding with Lovanium, a small planet with intelligent life placed in the center of 4 different solar systems. Now, Sasha and her crew must race against time to repair the ship and return before the wormhole closes, leaving them trapped there forever.

SHOPS

After discovering that the metal required to repair the ship is precisely used as currency by the people of Lovanium, Sasha gets the mayor's authorization to manage 3 shops within the trading village.

Flower shop: Flowers are highly appreciated in Lovanium, the rarer they are, the more valuable.

Food Market: Everybody needs to eat, and it's no different in Lovanium. Go hunting for wild animals, fruits, and fish.

Jewelry: The ancient people of Lovanium believed that the more shimmering stones you possess, the closer you are to your ancestors. So, grab your pickaxe and make a fortune through mining.

SUNS

As Lovanium is situated in the middle of 4 solar systems, there is no night. A daily cycle is lit by 4 distinct suns, each of which alters gameplay behavior. Therefore, understanding their benefits is crucial to achieving your objectives.

The white sun is like our morning on Earth. It shines brightly, but it's not very hot.

30% chance to get an extra drop of plants, fruits and rocks.

The yellow sun is not as bright and a bit warmer. It's when the monsters come out to hunt with more visibility.

20% chance to get an extra drop from monsters and 30% faster respawn.

Since the monsters are not big fans of the blue sun, the wealthier customers safely come to the city to do their shopping.

20% fewer monsters, and a 10% chance to receive a tip on sales.

The red sun is very dangerous for humans. The ship's dormitory is the safest place to rest.

-5 energy per second

QUESTS:

Like any good RPG, quests are warmly welcomed, and they contribute to the richness of the story of Lovanium. The ship's crew members will assign you tasks related to each of their expertise areas, and all of these are necessary to fulfill the ultimate objective, which is to make it back to Earth.

The ship's crew is composed of:

  • Biologist

  • Mechanic

  • Archeologist

  • Engineer

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Core 2 Duo
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Discreet video card
  • Storage: 160 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: 3.2 GHz Quad Core 2.0 (or higher)
  • Memory: 6 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4000 and higher, ATI Radeon HD-Series 4650 and higher, Nvidia GeForce 2xx-Series and up
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 160 MB available space

short_description: Find a way to escape Lovanium before it's too late. Extract resources, trade them, confront the wildest and most dangerous enemies, and fully harness the power of the suns. Are you up for it?
supported_languages: English, French, Spanish - Spain, Portuguese - Brazil, Russian, Simplified Chinese
